results.p: 5 days ago — 1. of, relating to, or suggestive of a wild beast; feral teeth; feral instincts. 2. a : not domesticated or cultivated : wild feral animals.

results.t: FERAL | definition in the Cambridge English Dictionary
results.p: existing in a wild state, especially describing an animal that was previously kept by people: feral dogs/cats
Feral is often used to describe a wild, untamed animal, like the feral cat with its claws and sharp teeth menacingly bared, ready to strike. Qualities that are ...
adjective · existing in a natural state, as animals or plants; not domesticated or cultivated; wild. · having reverted to the wild state, as from domestication:.

results.t: FERAL definition and meaning | Collins English Dictionary
results.p: If you describe something or someone as feral, you mean that they seem wild, fierce, and uncontrolled. [literary].
FERAL meaning: 1 : of, relating to, or resembling a wild beast; 2 : used to describe an animal (such as a cat or dog) that has escaped and become wild.

results.t: FERAL Synonyms: 116 Similar and Opposite Words
results.p: 6 days ago — Some common synonyms of feral are bestial, brutal, and brutish. While all these words mean characteristic of an animal in nature, action, or instinct.
A feral (from Latin fera 'a wild beast') animal or plant is one that lives in the wild but is descended from domesticated individuals.
Adjective · Wild; untamed. · (of an animal) Wild but descended from domestic or captive ancestors. · (of a person) Contemptible; unruly; misbehaved.
Feral means not tamed or habituated to human contact or presence. The word is usually used in reference to domesticated animals that have been ...
